snippet.title: Stipes deem winner Cellarman ineligible
snippet.content: A WINNING horse at Gosford last Saturday had to be subsequently disqualified this week after it was found to be ineligible for the race. Racing NSW stewards fined Chris Waller $200 for nominating Cellarman for the Class 2 Handicap, which the horse went on to win before being subsequently disqualified. RACE WATCH: TOP TIPS: Cellarman had only won one race before Saturday's outing but it was a Listed race, meaning the horse was automatically considered a Class 5 horse. Stewards told Racing Confidential it was a data issue and that internal mechanisms, which are in place to reject such nominations, weren't triggered. They are undergoing an internal review to ensure it doesn't happen again. Sir Magic is the new winner of the race.O'Shea charged over strangles case RACING NSW stewards have issued charges against former Godolphin Australia employees and John O'Shea as the strangles inquiry gets set to continue on Friday. Former Godolphin Australia managing director Plumptre and former head trainer O'Shea were presented with the following charges in relation to Godolphin racehorse Polemic being infected with strangles, a highly contagious infectious disease of the upper respiratory tract, in August 2016. Plumptre was issued with one charge under AR64K (2) for not reporting to Racing NSW as soon as possible that Polemic was confirmed as being infected with strangles from on or about August 5 last year. O'Shea was issued with two charges - the first under AR175(l) for being a party to Plumptre committing a breach of AR64K (2) for not reporting to Racing NSW as soon as possible that Polemic was confirmed as being infected with strangles from on or about August 4 last year. O'Shea has also been charged under AR175(g) of providing false and/or misleading evidence in a stewards' interview on June 16 and a stewards' inquiry on June 27. The hearing of the charges has been scheduled to be conducted at Racing NSW headquarters at 10:30am on Friday.Track switch ANOTHER meeting has been transferred from the Newcastle course proper to the Beaumont track. The alteration for the August 15 meeting comes after a meeting between Racing NSW and Newcastle Jockey Club officials. As a result, these program amendments will occur: Race 1 Benchmark 65 Handicap was 900m is now 1150m Race 4 Class 1 & Maiden Plate was 2300m is now 2200m Race 5 F & M Maiden Plate was 1400m is now 1350m Race 6 CG & E Maiden Plate was 1400m is now 1350m Race 7 3YO Maiden Plate was 900m is now 1150m Race 2 and 3 remain unchanged at 1300m. ***** DON'T forget to throw your support behind the benefit night for the family of late jockey Darren Jones on August 24. The event will be held at Tamworth racecourse and will be hosted by Sky Racing's Greg Radley. Leading and legendary former jockey Malcolm Johnston will be guest speakers on the night. Tickets are $50 each and children can attend for free. earlier this year. Proceeds from the benefit night will go to Darren's wife and two young children. Donations can be made to the Darren Jones family Appeal (BSB: 932 000, Account No: 000753692). Originally published as
